TopicTitle: Outdated mods even though i have the most updated version of these mods.

Articles.Content:
So, yesterday i updated the mods i had installed on CKAN and loaded KSP... and this happened, and i believe it might also be the problem that crashed the game when i tried to launch a rocket

1 hour ago, FabioofSpace said:

yesterday i updated the mods i had installed on CKAN

Did you manually update them or did CKAN suggest it?      If you manually updated some mods to the most current version, and are running an older version of KSP than they are designed for, then you should expect some problems.   CKAN usually has the most current mod version installed for the KSP version your are running.    I would recommend uninstalling anything you did manually, and then using CKAN to reinstall them.

Quote

Did you manually update them or did CKAN suggest it?      If you manually updated some mods to the most current version, and are running an older version of KSP than they are designed for, then you should expect some problems.   CKAN usually has the most current mod version installed for the KSP version your are running.    I would recommend uninstalling anything you did manually, and then using CKAN to reinstall them. 

 

CKAN suggested it, i remember deleting all my manually installed mods months ago. This is honestly weird, i'm gonna check again once it's day time in my part of Europe

CKAN can take up to a week to get an update linked. It's not an automatic thing. The image on your screen, the AVP, picks up on new updates quicker since it is contained within the mod.

Just give CKAN some time. It will catch up. Otherwise, you'll have to manually install the updates.

I guess, you are irritated by the "update available" notification of AVC and not the "compatibility issues"?

There are some curious things going on there. Did you update the repository by clicking on "Refresh" in CKAN? Did you set any additional KSP version to be compatible in the CKAN settings? What I noticed so far:

Kerbal Atomics:
CKAN/NETKAN issue. The version numbering seem to confuse CKAN. While CKAN should install 1.0.1.0, it installs 1:1.0.0 instead and even doesn't list the mod if you run KSP 1.7.0 and 1.6 is not set to be a compatible KSP version, even though 1.0.1.0 is listed to be compatible with 1.7:

Spoiler

I would suggest to report it here: https://github.com/KSP-CKAN/NetKAN/issues

ScienceLabInfo:
Apparently, the online .version file got updated to 0.9.6 but there is no actual update available. At least, github and SpaceDock still provide 0.9.5. Report it to the mod creator:

Community Category Kit:
Not sure what happend there, works fine for me. Please check which verion number is shown by CKAN.

Community Resource Pack:
Same as above.

TweakScale:
Again, works fine for me.

For the last three mods, select the mod in CKAN and take a look at the "Versions" tab on the right side and if the latest version is actually listed there and green highlighted.

 

Edited May 12, 2019 by 4x4cheesecake
typo, there are probably more :P
